sections.heading: Specify a Variable Type
sections.description: There may be times when you want to specify a type on to a variable. This can be done with casting. Python is an object-orientated language, and as such it uses classes to define data types, including its primitive types. Casting in python is therefore done using constructor functions:

code_blocks.code:
x = int(1)   # x will be 1

y = int(2.8) # y will be 2

z = int("3") # z will be 3

x = float(1)     # x will be 1.0

y = float(2.8)   # y will be 2.8

z = float("3")   # z will be 3.0

w = float("4.2") # w will be 4.2

x = str("s1") # x will be 's1'

y = str(2)    # y will be '2'

z = str(3.0)  # z will be '3.0'
